title: Northallerton Walks

images.title: wfmillar / Northallerton
images.caption: War memorial with the Parish Church of All Saints. This Grade I listed church was built on the site of an earlier 7th century church. The current church was commissioned by Bishop Thomas Hatfield of Durham and dates from the 12th century with parts from the 13th, 14th and 15th centuries.

images.title: Bob Embleton / Market Cross, Northallerton
images.caption: Market Cross, Northallerton. Plaque refers to it being an "Ancient" market cross restored in 1914. With the Town Hall in the background.

images.title: Bob Embleton / The Golden Lion Hotel, Northallerton
images.caption: The Golden Lion Hotel, Northallerton. The main hotel in the town. One of the North's major coaching and posting inns during the Stage Coach era. Stabling existed for seventy five horses and famous coaches arrived daily. It was reconstructed in the 1730s, but medieval stone, an old well and Tudor brickwork found in the subsequent alterations suggest a much older inn on the site. F

images.title: Bob Embleton / Northallerton Market
images.caption: Northallerton High Street with the market

description: This market town is located in the Hambleton District of North Yorkshire. It's located close to the heather moorland of the North York Moors National Park and the splendid Hambleton Hills where you can pick up the Cleveland Way National Trail. Other highlights include the nearby Mount Grace Priory where there are some fine trails around the historic Carthusian ruins. Near here you can pick up the Lyke Wake Walk and visit the lovely Cod Beck Reservoir at the attractive village of Osmotherley . In the town itself the 12th century Church of All Saints is a must see.
